creator: eppstein@ics.uci.edu
text:
I've been experimenting with svg as the output to some custom graph-drawing
code, and attempted to use batik-rasterizer to produce pdf from the resulting
svg files. The resulting pdf has the correct content, but is clipped so that
only the upper left corner is visible, both when I open it with Acrobat Reader 5
and when I open it with OS X Preview.app.  Also, when I attempt to open the file
in Adobe Illustrator, it fails, with the message "Acrobat PDF file format is
having difficulties.  Could not create internal representation of XAP metadata."

Curiously, the entireBatik rasterization to image/png does not have the same
problem, the whole image is visible.  It's possible that there's some problem
with my input svg (since I generated it myself) but it has height, width, and
viewBox attributes and is displayed correctly by Adobe Illustrator and by the
Adobe SVG browser plugin, and is handled correctly by batik-rasterizer -m
image/png.  I will make an attachment with the problematic svg, pdf, and png files.

Created attachment 7851
pdf with bad clipping box created from svg by batik-rasterizer
creator: eppstein@ics.uci.edu

text:
Created attachment 7852
png generated by batik-rasterizer, no apparent problems
creator: eppstein@ics.uci.edu
